Specific Details: Aighneacht i leith an leasaithe molta sa Bhille Oideachais i dtaobh critéir iontrála sna scoileanna lán-Ghaeilge
DPOs Lobbied: Kathleen Funchion|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Richard Bruton|Minister|Department of Education and Skills::Thomas Byrne|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Fiona McLoughlin Healy|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Éamon Ó Cuív|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Aighneacht i leith an leasaithe molta sa Bhille Oideachais i dtaobh critéir iontrála sna scoileanna lán-Ghaeilge
Intended Results: Go mbeadh foráil ar leith ann a thugann tús áite d’iarrthóirí arb í an Ghaeilge an phríomhtheanga bhaile acu sna critéir rollacháin i gcás ró-éilimh agus gur ceart imfhálaithe é.::Ag tógáil cheist na siblíní san áireamh agus sa chás ansin gur mó na spásanna atá ar fáil ná líon na n-iarratas, go mbeadh sé de ceart ag bunscoileanna lán-Ghaeilge freastal ar naíonra lán-Ghaeilge a aithint mar chritéir iontrála i bhfianaise an tábhacht a bhaineann leis an tréimhse luath-thumtha sa teanga agus na buntáistí teangeolaíochta a bhronnann an t-eispéireas seo.::Dá mbeadh freastal ar naíonra sainithe, ní bheadh aon ghá le meicníochtaí eile tástáil teanga aois-oiriúnach a dhéanamh ar an bpáiste mar go mbeadh sé intuigthe go raibh cumas agus bunús ann ar mian le tuismitheoirí go leanfaí leis agus go ndéanfaí a threisiú.::I gcás na n-iarbhunscoileanna lán-Ghaeilge go mbeadh sé de cheart acu tús áite a thabhairt a) do dhaltaí arb í an Ghaeilge an phríomhtheanga bhaile acu chun an ceart a dhaingniú go bhfaighfí oideachas i dteanga dhúchais an pháiste agus b) do dhaltaí a d’fhreastal ar bhunscoil lán-Ghaeilge chun nach séanfaí an ceart ar dhaltaí leanúint sa chóras oideachais lán-Ghaeilge.::Sa chóras nua bunaithe scoile atá á fhorbairt, go bhforbrófaí meicníocht fheidhmiúil agus tacúil do thuismitheoirí ar mian leo oideachas lán-Ghaeilge dá gcuid bpáistí mar réiteach ar an dúshlán ollmhór a bhaineann le ró-éileamh ar bhunscoileanna agus iarbhunscoileanna lán-Ghaeilge.
Lobbying Activities: Aighneacht seolta chuig: Kathleen Funchion, Éamon Ó Cuív, Thomas Byrne, Richard Bruton, Fiona McLoughlin-Healy|Submission|1::Comhrá leis an Aire Bruton ag oscaile oifigiúil Gaelscoil Mhic Aodha, Cill Dara, 1 Meitheamh 2018.|Informal communication|1

Specific Details: Difficulties faced by businesses at intra-EU borders due to non uniform COVID restrictions to limit non-essential travel
DPOs Lobbied: John Callinan|Second Secretary General|Department of the Taoiseach::Thomas Byrne|Minister of State|Department of the Taoiseach
Subject Matter: Difficulties faced by businesses at intra-EU borders due to non uniform COVID restrictions to limit non-essential travel
Intended Results: A more uniform approach to national measures aimed at restricting non-essential travel within the EU.
Lobbying Activities:
Among the issues raised, Chambers report that businesses face excessive administration with regard to the translation of documents , inconsistent quarantine times, inaccessibility of official documents, unintelligible rules and congested green lanes due to disproportionate enforcement measures deployed at internal borders. The mutual recognition of tests as well remains an important issue.
These obstacles have a direct impact on intra-EU trade and make it difficult for companies to fulfil contractual obligations.|Email|1

Specific Details: Called on European Commission Vice-President Maroš Šefcovic to relay 1 April and 1 July preparation concerns with UK counterparts, called for the need for the UK to publish the Border Operating Model, raised concerns about operations at Calais as a destination port and raised concerns about the application of different Covid-19 testing rules for supply chain workers across the EU.
DPOs Lobbied: Simon Coveney|Minister|Department of Foreign Affairs::Thomas Byrne|Minister of State|Department of the Taoiseach
Subject Matter: Called on European Commission Vice-President Maroš Šefcovic to relay 1 April and 1 July preparation concerns with UK counterparts, called for the need for the UK to publish the Border Operating Model, raised concerns about operations at Calais as a destination port and raised concerns about the application of different Covid-19 testing rules for supply chain workers across the EU.
Intended Results: For the Commissioner to raise concerns at the highest levels in the UK to ensure preparations are made for the phased introduction of import controls and to make the Commissioner aware of the impact that the application of different Covid-19 testing rules is having on supply chain workers and intra-EU trade flows.

Specific Details: Possible Taxation reform Action 3.7 of the National Sports Policy Action Plan
DPOs Lobbied: Thomas Byrne|Minister of State|Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media::Daniel Griffin|Special Adviser|Department of Education
Subject Matter: Possible Taxation reform Action 3.7 of the National Sports Policy Action Plan
Intended Results:
Action Plan proposals for taxation reform put forward in the context of Budget 2024 and further budgetary deliberations. The proposals fall under the following headings and in order of preference:
1.	Extending relief on donations to approved sporting bodies.
2.	VAT relief for sporting bodies.
3.	Granting of charitable status to those NGBs and LSPs who wish to pursue that option.
4.	Tax-driven incentives for personal exercise
Lobbying Activities:
The meeting took place on June 28th with Minister Thomas Byrne and Daniel Griffin. The Federation of Irish Sport was represented by Mary O Connor CEO and Bryan Hughes A&L Goodbody who presented the business cases under the following heading:
1.	Extending relief on donations to approved sporting bodies.
2.	VAT relief for sporting bodies.
3.	Granting of charitable status to those NGBs and LSPs who wish to pursue that option.
4.	Tax-driven incentives for personal exercise
|Meeting|1

Specific Details: LSSIF Criteria 2024 - Removal of Stream 1 funding
DPOs Lobbied: Thomas Byrne|Minister of State|Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media::Cian Ó Lionáin|Assistant Secretary|Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media::Daniel Griffin|Special Adviser|Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media
Subject Matter: LSSIF Criteria 2024 - Removal of Stream 1 funding
Intended Results: The inclusion of stream 1 funding for applicants. Stream 1 funding was vital to help with the design and was of huge assistance to NGB’s who do not currently have the significant financial resources to fund the design and feasibility phase of the project themselves and it would critically allow them to work towards the realisation of a strategic goal for their sport.
Lobbying Activities: The request for Stream 1 funding to be included in LSSIF criteria as  the only funding available incorporated both the design and the construction element of the proposed project and by there not being a separate stream for design funding only it completely rules out NGBs with any ambition to invest in infrastructure to play their sport and indeed increase participation. |Letter|1
